titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Jon Bracker, 1965-1970, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Mary McSparran

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 21:53:39 -0500.

change.item: Edits and rearrangement of content into requisite Lilly EAD structure, including addition of abstract, bioghist, scopecontent, controlaccess, relatedmaterial, and c01 levels of container list. Haley Suby.
Batch update to change subject links.

did.abstract: The Bracker mss., 1965-1970, consists of the correspondence of poet and author Jon Bracker, 1936-.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jonathan Bracker, who has also published under the name Jon Bracker, was born in 1936 and studied at the University of Texas at Austin. He is a San Francisco-based poet, editor, and author whose work has appeared in the New Yorker, Poetry Northwest, the RavensPerch, and Writer's Digest, among other periodicals and collections. Bracker is the editor of Bright Cages: The Selected Poems of Christopher Morley (1965); co-author of the Twayne Press Christopher Morley (1976); and editor of A Little Patch of Shepherd's-Thyme: Prose Passages of Thomas Hardy Arranged as Verse (2013). He has also taught at colleges and universities in California, Texas, Pennsylvania, and Indiana. His books of poetry include Constellations of Clover (1973), Duplicate Keys (1977), Paris Sketches (2005), and Concerning Poetry: Poems about Poetry (2018).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Bracker mss., 1965-1970, consist of letters written by prominent authors to Jon Bracker, 1936- , author. Included are also a few letters by Bracker. They relate chiefly to poetry.

Among the authors are Nelson Algren, Mary Allinson, Louis Stanton Auchincloss, Vance Nye Bourjaily, James Mallanhan Cain, Hortense Calisher, John Cheever, John Dos Passos, Richard Eberhart, Paul Goodman, Denise Levertov, Archibald MacLeish, Vassar Miller, George Oppen, William DeWitt Snodgrass, William E. Stafford, Lionel Trilling, Robert Penn Warren, Isabel Wilder. There is also an article by Hans Froelicher entitled "Fragments about Christopher Darlington Morley."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Bracker mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
